body:
Fixed in the `dev-magics` branch. Making a PR. Btw the error regex wasn't always working for me; I changed it to `(\r\n|$)` at the end.

I also don't get a problem with commands returning both text and images in hydrogen?
![magic_hydrogen_plot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4219197/44003542-f33915f0-9e21-11e8-97c4-600086aac39d.png)
@mcaceresb is the bottom of the graph cut off in your example or is that how Stata exports it?
Ah, it's cut off! Sadness. Back to the drawing board. Def had the right idea, tho.
This is turning out to be very difficult to solve. I can either have the full image with the whitespace on hydrogen on have it cropped =/; still looking for a fix...
Ok. I can look into it as well if you'd like.

I made a mistake [here](https://github.com/kylebarron/stata_kernel/blob/master/stata_kernel/stata_session.py#L733-L736). Lines 735 and 735 should be swapped. That fixes the cropping but brings back the whitespace.

This harkens back to the `_fix_svg_size` function in `stata_session.py`. SVG images don't automagically resize just because the kernel says so. Hence I fiddle with the "width" and "height" attributes in the SVG metadata. But this introduces whitespace in Hydrogen because I think Hydrogen keeps the original aspect ratio for some reason...

Ok, so, the way to fix it is to do away with this `_fix_svg_size` function and instead just specify width and height in `graph export`.

```
        graph_export_size = {
            'pdf': None,
            'svg': ' width({0}px) height({1}px)',
            'tif': ' width({0}) height({1})',
            'png': ' width({0}) height({1})'}
        self.graph_size = graph_export_size[self.graph_format]
```

And then

```
        if self.graph_size:
            export_size = self.graph_size.format(*img_metadata.values())
        else:
            export_size = ''
```

and just add that to the export statement.
That makes a lot more sense. Thanks. Then we don't need the xml minidom stuff at all?

I'll do it as a PR later from the magics branch. I also want to remove all the options magics I've made and put them in a single `%set` magic, which will hopefully be a more familiar way of setting options for Stata users.
Ok. It might be simpler to merge if it's its own PR
Ok. I'll do it as its own PR. Can you assign me the issue?

Yeah I was originally thinking something like `%set` or `%config` where all of the settings are also values in the global `~/.stata_kernel.conf`. That way `%set` or `%config` sets them for the rest of the session but if the user wants them to be set permanently they can set them in the conf file.

https://github.com/kylebarron/stata_kernel/issues/40

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15164633/44109581-6337c55e-9fcb-11e8-8382-431358c0569c.png)
idk why it isn't letting me assign it to you
You can do `%set --permanently` to edit the config file.

Ok awesome.

I'm feeling exhausted and a little burnt out. I think I need to take a day or two off.

> I'm feeling exhausted and a little burnt out.

You can only give so much at a time to these types of projects. Typically the set of ideas for things to do is several orders of magnitude the set of things that can get done in a reasonable amount of time, right? And it's not like anything's gonna break if you leave the project simmer for a bit.

Yes, but 1) I happen to have been injured and unable to go cycling and 2) my significant other has been out of town. That's what opened up a several dozen hours in 10 days to work on this. I want to get a bit more done, at least the big async rewrite, in the next few days before those time sinks return.
